editorialNotes.short: Something's very wrong here. Can you make it through the night?

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: A hugely ambitious action blockbuster, Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas is filled with sharp satire, fascinatingly flawed characters, and a huge variety of ways to play. Explore the cities and countryside of a vividly realized fictional version of the southwestern United States. You can tackle story-driven quests, gorge on fast food, outrun the police, or obey every traffic lightâ€”itâ€™s up to you. This enormous game deftly displays Rockstarâ€™s unique mastery of open-world design, and it never fails to entertain.
The latest in this gorgeous, long-running tower defense series adds cool twists, like playing with two heroes at once.
Talk about wild family outings! Help the Bergson bunch battle evil in this gorgeous throwback RPG.

ios.subtitle: Itâ€™s not a bug, itâ€™s a feature

editorialNotes.tagline: Can you become king of the hill?

ios.subtitle: Feed Hungry Fish And Grow Big

editorialNotes.standard: Dead Cells is a celebration of perseverence: In this game, death is never final, but an essential learning tool. With every new run through ever-changing, enemy-infested levels, you get a little stronger and a little more skilled at overcoming relentless adversariesâ€”and gradually overcome obstacles that once felt insurmountable. The acclaimed roguelike platformer makes all rewards feel earned; you'll be motivated to to brush off mistakes and charge back into battle again and again.

Pixel-perfect art brings a lost world to life in the gorgeous Hyper Light Drifter. Explore vivid forests, bright landscapes, and the shell of a high-tech society overgrown by nature as you seek to cure a fatal illness. Packing silky smooth, lightning-fast combat, Hyper Light Drifter is a blastâ€”even when youâ€™re just admiring the scenery.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: In this gorgeous twist on the infinite runner, you guide an agile snowboarder down a never-ending mountain, pulling off backflips over icy chasms and grinding along rooftops in sleepy villages. Simple one-finger controls make it instantly accessible, but tackling each levelâ€™s trio of challenges requires deft reflexes. With its exquisitely rendered visuals, soothing music, and finely tuned gameplay, Altoâ€™s Adventure is simultaneously serene and exciting.
editorialNotes.short: We're obsessed with nailing the perfect run while admiring the gorgeous scenery.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.tagline: Don't let the zombies stop you

editorialNotes.standard: Pencil in time for nostalgic cannon duels in this hand-drawn reimagining of an old-school classic, where cannonballs fly while scribbled tumbleweeds bounce across graphite landscapes.

Youâ€™re a goat, free to run wild and cause mayhem in a virtual town. And trust us: that premise leads to tons of hilarious moments and stunts. Weâ€™ve crashed parties, head-butted cars, bounced on trampolines, and done a million other goofy things in this outrageous sandbox game.
Follow the story of the acclaimed animeâ€”or hop straight into battle as your favorite heroesâ€”in the action-packed mobile version of the 2008 fighting game.

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.tagline: Clean up Gotham one brick at a time
editorialNotes.standard: Warner Bros. continues its tradition of App Store excellence with this clever bite-sized brawler, which mashes up the family-friendly LEGO brand with a classic comic-style good vs. evil story. Whether you take up Batman's cape and cowl or step into the shoes of a number of other Justice League heroes, saving Gotham City is a charming adventure for gamers of all ages.

editorialNotes.tagline: Ollie and flip for high scores
editorialNotes.standard: Sure, there are skateboarding games that let you pull 900s from telephone wires, then land in a manual, collecting millions of points. But when you want realism and complexity, you want True Skate. For years, True Axisâ€™ skateboarding simulator has been letting us ollie, grind, and kickflip with our fingers. Competing with your friends, scouting gaps, and completing missions is great fun, but the true reward is perfecting a line and nailing incredible tricks with just the right swipes.

The unstoppable, poppable Bloons series gets better with each installment, and this entry in the cute-but-cunning tower-defense franchise is no exception. Bloons TD 5 is adorable and quirky, but thereâ€™s an astonishing amount of content, tactical depth, and replayability to go along with the goofy weapons, helium-filled interlopers, and priceless monkey business.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Building upon 2Kâ€™s tactical masterpiece XCOM: Enemy Unknown, Enemy Within adds a bevy of new features that fundamentally alter and improve the experience. With new abilities and mission parameters unlocked from the very first mission, Enemy Within injects tension and surprise into every corner. Fans of Enemy Unknown will find a wealth of new weapons, enemies, and maps that change the gameâ€™s flow, while new players will be enthralled as they fend off an alien invasion in intense, turn-based battles.

Tiny Wings has been a longtime favorite of ours, thanks to its gentle vibe, fantastic music, and surprisingly awesome one-touch gameplay. Outrunning the sun across procedurally generated islands is rewarding and relaxing, and we love the added challenge of the four-bird race mode. The gameâ€™s vivid, vibrant colors absolutely dazzle on Apple TVâ€”we feel like weâ€™re meeting our flightless friends for the first time again.
Catchy music, incredible combo-filled combat, co-op play, and a blast of nostalgic spirit ensures this classic brawling series still packs a punch.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Beautiful levels and a lovable mustachioed hero take the spotlight in Leoâ€™s Fortune, a platformer that blends physics-based puzzles and timing challenges with a flurry of fresh concepts and delightfully challenging gameplay. Blast through the air from a pirateâ€™s cannon, explore underwater caverns, or run for your life during intense chase sequences. Leoâ€™s Fortune is a feast for the eyes and an immensely satisfying journey from start to finish.

The concept behind Kingdom Rush Frontiers is exceptionally simple: take the same great ideas, visual style, and fiendishly difficult tower defense that millions fell in love with in the original game and improve it by adding tons of incredible content. Frontiers packs new heroes, settings, towers, and tons of fresh enemies to fend off, making the frenzied action even harder to put down.

The Dynamic Duo take to the stars in a brick-bashing adventure the whole family will love. As you travel from the Batcave to the Justice League Watchtower to deep space, hilarious banter and breezy puzzles make for classic LEGOÂ®-game shenanigans. And with more than 100 playable charactersâ€”everyone from DC mainstays (The Flash, Wonder Woman, Sinestro) to delightful lesser-knowns (Etrigan, Plastic Man, Stargirl)â€”the fan service is unreal.
Mash through waves of foes as a heavily armed potato in this spud-tacular arena survival game.

editorialNotes.standard: Team up with an ancient Mayan warrior and solve perilous puzzles in this twin-stick adventure.

editorialNotes.standard: From the makers of indie masterpiece Bastion, this stunning RPG thrusts you into a hauntingly beautiful sci-fi world brimming with intrigue. To unravel the mysteries of Cloudbank, youâ€™ll need to fight robotic goons in intense tactical battles while modifying your weapon with powerful new abilities. Transistorâ€™s gorgeous artwork, affecting soundtrack, and riveting story all blend to create a truly one-of-a-kind experience.

GoatZ poses a simple question: How long can you survive the apocalypse â€¦ as a zombie goat? This hilariously absurd follow-up to Goat Simulator takes tons of survival-game conventionsâ€”like crafting, time-based challenges, and a big, open worldâ€”and wraps them together in a package intentionally littered with glitches. As you make your way around town, licking trash cans and head-butting zombies, the ridiculous bugs and hysterical premise will have you laughing out loud. Itâ€™s dumb fun in the best way.

editorialNotes.tagline: Tap, tap, tap to the beat

editorialNotes.standard: Set in a snowy Nordic fantasy world, Bad North is about doing the best you can with what youâ€™ve got. Command troops of archers, swordsmen, and more as you protect a chain of islands from marauders, but one wrong move can prove costly. Tense, slick, and stylish, Bad North is a heady blend of tactical combat, strategic planning, and intuitive controls.

editorialNotes.standard: Turnip Boyâ€™s planning a heistâ€”and like his last adventure, this one is seasoned with plant-tastic puns and laugh-out-loud situations.

editorialNotes.standard: This breakneck chapter in the Riptide GP series is so intense, itâ€™s got us reaching for a life jacket. Or maybe several: Renegadeâ€™s solo campaign packs tons of water-racing events and sick tricks to master. (Split-screen local and eight-player online matches are our favorites.) However you play, stunning tracks like a gorgeous forest river deliver awesome arcade thrills. On Apple TV, it's our 2016 Game of the Year.
editorialNotes.short: Manage your speed and watch out for waves in this brilliant water-racing sequel.
